import { Col, Row, Accordion } from "react-bootstrap"; import OperatorTable from "./OperatorTable"; import ExampleGroup from "./ExampleGroup"; const EXAMPLES_1 = ["A", "~A", "~~A", "A * ~A"]; const EXAMPLES_2 = ["A + 1", "A + 0", "A + B", "A + ~B"]; const EXAMPLES_3 = [ "m(2, 3, 7, 9, 11, 13)", "m(2, 3, 7, 9, 11, 13) + d(1, 10, 15)", "~(A^C)@(B%D)", "(A+~C+B*D)*(~A+(~B+D)*(C+~D))", ]; export default function AboutAccordion(props) { let handleClick = (e) => { props.onClick(e); }; return (

Operator Symbols / Examples / About

About

This application can simplifiy either a boolean algebra expression or a set of minimum terms and "don't care" terms. Both Quine McCluskey's Algorithm and Petrick's Method are utilized to reduce an expression to its minimum sum-of-products. An Earley Parser is used to parse expressions given by the user. This project and the Earley Parser were written by Andrew Miner.{" "} Check out the GitHub!

); }
